thread.title: After collision, Brad Marchand absent from Bruins practice | Bruins Insider |
thread.title_full: After collision, Brad Marchand absent from Bruins practice | Bruins Insider | | Boston Herald

author: Stephen Harris
title: After collision, Brad Marchand absent from Bruins practice | Bruins Insider |
text:
WILMINGTON — Brad Marchand was absent from Bruins practice today after suffering what appeared to be a concussion on his collision with Montreal’s Dale Weise in Saturday night's 4-2 loss at the Garden.
Marchand connected with Weise's elbow and was very slow to get up. He made his way back to the bench with a little help from teammate Colin Miller and needed some help to get back to the dressing room.
In Marchand's absence, Brett Connolly moved onto Patrice Bergeron’s line with Loui Eriksson on the left.
The No. 3 line had Ryan Spooner between Chris Kelly and Jimmy Hayes. David Krejci was on a line with Matt Beleskey and David Pastrnak.
Zdeno Chara was back in practice and appears to be close to ready. The struggling Bruins host the Tampa Bay Lightning tomorrow afternoon.
Defenseman Matt Irwin, who's had an inauspicious start with his new team — a minus-5 in the first two games — was not on the ice at today's practice.
